block.p: Samantha Charlotte Barnes, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. V. Lee Barnes of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to Gus Christensen, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Christensen III of Brooklyn. The Rev. Robert M. Alves, the rector of St. Barnabas Episcopal Church in Greenwich, performed the ceremony there, with the Rev. Joel M. Ives, another Episcopal priest, taking part.
The bride and bridegroom met at Yale, from which they graduated.

Samantha Charlotte Barnes, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. V. Lee Barnes of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to Gus Christensen, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Christensen III of Brooklyn. The Rev. Robert M. Alves, the rector of St. Barnabas Episcopal Church in Greenwich, performed the ceremony there, with the Rev. Joel M. Ives, another Episcopal priest, taking part.
The bride and bridegroom met at Yale, from which they graduated.

Mrs. Christensen, 33, manages and markets the Veuve Clicquot Champagne brand in the United States. She received an M.B.A. degree from Northwestern. Her father is a management consultant based in Greenwich.

Mr. Christensen, 35, is a vice president for mergers and acquisitions at Evercore Partners, investment bankers in Manhattan. He received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother, Constance L. Christensen, retired as a vice president in the legal department at Citibank in Manhattan and is now a trustee of the Brooklyn Museum and a director of the Citizens' Committee for Children in Manhattan. His father is a partner in Sullivan & Cromwell, the Manhattan law firm, and is the chairman of the Prospect Park Alliance and a trustee of the Brooklyn Academy of Music.
